citations.narrative:
There were 30 weaned puppies in enclosures containing mixed litters, 10 of which did not have any individual
identification, such as a tag, tattoo/microchip or collar.
Appropriate identification of dogs is necessary to ensure that each animal’s identity can be known with certainty and to
meet recordkeeping requirements for inventory, disposition, transport, and healthcare documentation. The facility must
properly identify all dogs, including puppies, with an acceptable form of identification as specified in this subpart.
Correct by February 6, 2026.

A 6-month-old female dog (ID-900263001200302) at the facility had a medical record on file, however the record had no
information or records. The program of veterinary care (PVC) states that all puppies will be given a Parvo/Distemper
vaccination at 6 and 8 weeks. The owner stated that the vaccinees had been given but that no record was available.
Failure to document the vaccination of animals makes it difficult to know if they were given and to evaluate if they are
receiving adequate veterinary care. The licensee must keep and maintain medical records that include the names of all
vaccines and treatments administered, and the dates of administration.
Correct by February 6, 2026.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
There were 30 weaned puppies in enclosures containing mixed litters, 10 of which did not have any individual 
identification, such as a tag, tattoo/microchip or collar. 
Appropriate identification of dogs is necessary to ensure that each animal’s identity can be known with certainty and to 
meet recordkeeping requirements for inventory, disposition, transport, and healthcare documentation. The facility must 
properly identify all dogs, including puppies, with an acceptable form of identification as specified in this subpart. 
Correct by February 6, 2026. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A 6-month-old female dog (ID-900263001200302) at the facility had a medical record on file, however the record had no 
information or records. The program of veterinary care (PVC) states that all puppies will be given a Parvo/Distemper 
vaccination at 6 and 8 weeks. The owner stated that the vaccinees had been given but that no record was available.  
Failure to document the vaccination of animals makes it difficult to know if they were given and to evaluate if they are 
receiving adequate veterinary care. The licensee must keep and maintain medical records that include the names of all 
vaccines and treatments administered, and the dates of administration. 
Correct by February 6, 2026. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
